intro: Draba kodarica, commonly known as the Kodaric whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. This species typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Draba kodarica is a perennial plant that is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high elevations.
